intro: Varronia dasycephala, commonly known as the woolly-headed mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, and its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its mucilaginous properties. Varronia dasycephala typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
